data.scheme_name: Margin Money Grant to Nano Units-For General category - Male
data.benefits: The scheme provides a margin money grant of up to 40% of the total project cost, with a maximum assistance of Rs. 4 lakh per unit.
data.eligibility: All new enterprises engaged in manufacturing, food processing, service sector and job works are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
Units with project cost upto 10 Lakh will be covered in the scheme.
Promoter’s contribution must be minimum 30 % of the project cost.
data.beneficiaries: All new enterprises engaged in manufacturing, food processing, service sector and job works are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
Units with project cost upto 10 Lakh will be covered in the scheme.
Promoter’s contribution must be minimum 30 % of the project cost.
data.nodal_agency: District Industries Centre, Directorate of Industries and Commerce
data.context: The scheme Margin Money Grant to Nano units(New) wants to promote / incentivize deserving entrepreneurs in setting up Nano Enterprises within the State through Margin Money Grant to Nano units for for loan linked projects.
data.objective: To promote/incentivize deserving entrepreneurs in setting up nano enterprises within the state through margin money grant for loan linked projects.
data.description:
Scheme provides the following financial assistance:
Loan from Financial Institution (Minimum) : 40%
Beneficiary Contribution (Minimum) : 40%
Margin Money Grant (Maximum) : 20%

Maximum assistance under this scheme shall be Rs 4 Lakh per unit.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://industry.kerala.gov.in/images/pdf/Nano-Grant-Application-Form.pdf
data.funding_mechanism: The assistance under the scheme shall be released to the eligible entrepreneur by bank on a pro-rata basis.
data.additional_info: Youth (Age between 18 and 40), Differentially Abled Persons, Ex-Servicemen will be eligible for 10% additional Grant.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Copy of Pass book 
2. Project Report
3. Title Deed of Land/Land Tax Receipt (if applicable)
4. Ownership Certificate of building (if applicable)
5. Registered Lease Deed or Rent Deed in such cases
6. Proforma Invoice/Quotation of plant, machinery and electrification
7. Valuation of approved Engineer, Chattered Engineer for Civil Construction
8. Sanction letter from financial institution/Bank (if any)
9. Any other document as demanded by the recommending/sanctioning authority
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: 
Directorate of Industries & Commerce,
3rd Floor, Vikas Bhavan P.O, Thiruvananthapuram,
Kerala - 695033.

Email id:  industriesdirectorate@gmail.com
Contact Details: 0471-2326756
data.beneficiary: Manufacturing and Service Industry - Proprietorship - Kerala - Micro
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
